How and Why this happened to me?
My right eye looks exactly like your profile photo.

People have said I'm a genius... but I know my weakness is in math... though I've had, done and used various mathematical concepts, through trig, linear algebra, calculus, and geometry. I don't seem to go really far enough in the math, and get lost in all the symbols... Ironically, the math I do use most often, I most often I have a fairly well developed concept visually of that mathematics, as it relates to physics, and that's as far as what I know goes... But, extending that, I find difficult nowadays, and though sources like Wikipedia are replete with, what I want, nay, need. Symbolic knowledge, and information, without the additional definitions of all the symbols and what they represent in those concepts, gets me I get lost... and at 63 years of age... I look back, and wistfully to the future, and just (sigh) oh to be in school again... pick up what I missed in math, I think, I could go so far in my physics. Convert visuals, images, and concepts into the appropriate language I need... mathematics. Mathematics can be so succinct, where words so verbose. I yearn for succinct.

That said, and the few videos I've seen here... I say, YOU are the freakin genius. I so look forward to mass consumption of your videos... Thank you so much. Theres still so much for me to learn... in fact, I've forgotten more than I currently know. But, what I retain is concepts, and as I age, I lose symbolic recollection, but concepts remain. And, oddly enough, I manage to retain or regain the symbols, at least for fairly long periods of time, even after lost and regained. So, I see a way for this old dog to still learn a few tricks... My primary love is physics... and I've always lacked the tools to express mathematically what I conceptually observe. This is going to be a wonderful journey. Again, thank you so much!

I am subscribed and have been for a while.  If I want formalism, I'll find a textbook; I like your videos because they strive for a more intuitive feel.  Digital video, with its animations and ability to rewind and replay are well suited to math education.  I'm taking a differential geometry course right now and the man teaching it has a style of teaching that is very intuitive like your videos.  Thank you!

Just imagine: he has achieved something that many people do not: he has gained the ability to not only visualize math, but convert those visions into code to animate what he sees in his mind, which is reflection of reality. This is incredibly impressive. Imagine those who came before us who have visualized these kinds of concepts without any insight, just the subtle hints that the universe we're enveloped in gives. There is a reason why they are called the Titans, and not to mention Newton, who himself was a god.
